en-us.learning_promise:
This unit introduces your students to Physical Science, Life Science, and Earth and Space Science. Prompted by stories with animals, students help Maria, Sofie, Leo, and Daniel answer questions about the natural world and how it’s made. They'll explore the diversity of animals and plants in different habitats. Next, they'll experience and explain how an object made of a set of small pieces can be disassembled and made into a new object so they can make food for a pet. Then they’ll develop models that mimic the function of an animal in pollinating plants and dispersing seeds. After that, they’ll examine and classify materials by the observable properties suited to building an animal shelter. Finally, they'll design a solution to slow or prevent wind from changing the shape of the land animals use at their park.  

Your students will also practice their social and emotional learning, such as self-regulation, persistence, empathy, self-awareness, and mindfulness with the main characters in the lesson stories.  

Before your students begin this unit, we recommend the following to support their building and programming skills and prepare them for the challenges in this unit. 
 - Access the LEGO® Education SPIKE™ [App][1] or install it on classroom devices.  

 - Complete the Tutorial Activities (under the Start menu item in the LEGO Education SPIKE App). 

 - Try one or more of the lessons in the [Amazing Amusement Park](https://education.lego.com/en-us/lessons/spikeessential-amazing-amusement-park) unit.  

 - In addition, find [professional development](https://pd.legoeducation.com/pages/37/homeroom-premium) support for hands-on learning, programming, and coding. (Create a free LEGO ID if you don’t have one.)


  [1]: https://education.lego.com/en-us/downloads/spike-app/software

lessons.lesson_description: Sofie learned about the places giraffes live. She wonders about the other animals that live there. What about other places? Can you help her learn?
lessons.student_worksheet_description: Sofie learned about the places giraffes live. She wonders about the other animals that live there. What about other places? Can you help her learn?

text.content:
Sofie learned about the places giraffes live. 
She wonders about the other animals that live there.

What about other places? 
Can you help her learn?

What is a habitat? 
What are some kinds you know?

What is in every animal’s habitat?
What is a giraffe’s habitat like?

What other animals and plants live there? 
Choose one to explore.

Work with a group.
Learn about one habitat.
Build it. Include plants and animals.

code_stack.title: SPIKE Essential Habitats
code_stack.xml: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" blockversion="12" ishorizontal="true" displaymonitorincludedimages="11"><variables></variables><block type="horizontalevents_whenColor" id="~(Ik__@1UNJ1OT{paRFm" x="156" y="369"><value name="COLOR"><shadow type="horizontalevents_horizontal-color-sensor" id="`yK1H[:w$N,sPu[!TW@q"><field name="field_horizontalevents_horizontal-color-sensor">5</field></shadow></value><next><block type="horizontalsound_playMusicSoundUntilDone" id="IB^D1)Vu6xGB(p2MYR[t"><value name="SOUND"><shadow type="horizontalsound_horizontal-music-sound" id="Thg()X1VP-]IUZx{Ejl2"><field name="field_horizontalsound_horizontal-music-sound">6</field></shadow></value></block></next></block></xml>

text.content:
Program your model. 
Show how animals live in that place.

What is the same about the plants and animals?
What is different?

Look again at the other models. 
How are they like yours? 
How are they different?

Choose one thing you saw. 
Program one animal to show it.
Great job!

teacher_support.things_you_will_need:
(one for every two students)
 - LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Essential Set
 - Device with the LEGO Education SPIKE App installed
 - See Prepare - Materials.

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Habitats

lessons.lesson_description: Leo wants to make something for his dog to eat. Help him build the tools he needs in the kitchen.
lessons.student_worksheet_description: Leo wants to make something for his dog to eat. Help him build the tools he needs in the kitchen.

text.content:
Leo wants to make something for his dog to eat. 
Help him build the tools he needs in the kitchen.
What are some common kitchen tools?

Choose two tools. 
What parts are the same? 
What parts are different?
Choose 10 different pieces from the SPIKE™ Essential box.

Describe them. 
What color, shape, and size are they?
How can you use them to build different kitchen tools?
Build a kitchen tool.

code_stack.title: SPIKE Essential Redesigning to Make New Objects
code_stack.xml: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" blockversion="12" ishorizontal="true" displaymonitorincludedimages="11"><variables></variables><block type="horizontalevents_whenProgramStarts" id="2AC-Z@H{6cZe$=-enA|W" x="147" y="337"><next><block type="horizontalmotor_motorSetSpeed" id="CYj}U*7r(Ng0M*Z[_(/D"><value name="SPEED"><shadow type="horizontalmotor_horizontal-motor-speed" id="6$s4Fr.hCKkD#MS+n6(b"><field name="field_horizontalmotor_horizontal-motor-speed">100</field></shadow></value><next><block type="horizontalmotor_motorTurnClockwiseRotations" id="^D[kj][@Pyf%,Uu{o)It"><value name="ROTATIONS"><shadow type="horizontalmotor_rotation-clockwise" id="ady]]]B_,G{:h!c6ZKje"><field name="field_horizontalmotor_rotation-clockwise">10</field></shadow></value></block></next></block></next></block></xml>

text.content:
Program your model. 
Show how the tool works to make food.
How will it help Leo?

Take  your model apart. 
Start to build another kitchen tool with the same LEGO® elements.

Use your model to explain; 
how did you use the LEGO® elements to make a kitchen tool?

Use your model to explain; 
how will your tool help Leo make food?

Use your model to explain; 
how is your kitchen tool different from others in the class?

Use your model to explain; 
how did you make a new tool with the same elements?

Keep building your new kitchen tool.
Program it. 
How will it help Leo?
Add lights, sounds, or a motor to make Leo’s work easier.
Great job!

teacher_support.things_you_will_need:
(one for every two students)
 - LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Essential Set
 - Device with the LEGO Education SPIKE App installed
 - See Prepare - -Materials.

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Redesigning to Make New Objects

lessons.lesson_description: Maria saw bees on the flowers of her apple tree. She wonders what they’re doing. Can you help her learn?
lessons.student_worksheet_description: Maria saw bees on the flowers of her apple tree. She wonders what they’re doing. Can you help her learn?

text.content:
Maria saw bees on the flowers of her apple tree. 
She wonders what they’re doing. 
Can you help her learn?
Why do plants need pollen?
How does it get from one flower to another?
How do the parts of a flower make this easier?

Build a model. 
Show how animals move pollen from one plant to another.

code_stack.title: SPIKE Essential Pollination
code_stack.xml: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" blockversion="12" ishorizontal="true" displaymonitorincludedimages="11"><variables></variables><block type="horizontalevents_whenProgramStarts" id="`OPU^Thg~E3)^n}7zz-b" x="247" y="318"><next><block type="control_forever" id=".DM;,2mc%KY:L(.=6k@q"><statement name="SUBSTACK"><block type="horizontalmotor_motorTurnCounterClockwiseRotations" id="O^RsTPmyx#W2%eE`ZKUk"><value name="ROTATIONS"><shadow type="horizontalmotor_rotation-counter-clockwise" id="M*lxS{W1q?#HYL^Rl2!#"><field name="field_horizontalmotor_rotation-counter-clockwise">0.5</field></shadow></value><next><block type="control_wait" id="wMslf$YFRQp(NFWzhKC;"><value name="DURATION"><shadow type="math_positive_number" id="mv5d{x`H2?[xYJlKS++0"><field name="NUM">2</field></shadow></value></block></next></block></statement></block></next></block></xml>

text.content:
Program your model. 
Show pollination. 
What happens?

Use your model to explain; 
which parts of the plant help move pollen?

Use your model to explain; 
which parts of the animal help?

Use your model to explain;
how do animals move pollen to different plants?

Use your model to explain; 
why is this important for plants?

Show one way that animals can spread seeds. 
Build a model. 
Program it.
Great job!

teacher_support.things_you_will_need:
(one for every two students)
 - LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Essential Set
 - Device with the LEGO Education SPIKE App installed
 - See Prepare - Materials.

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Pollination

lessons.lesson_description: Daniel got some chickens. Help him build a chicken coop where they’ll be safe and comfortable.
lessons.student_worksheet_description: Daniel got some chickens. Help him build a chicken coop where they’ll be safe and comfortable.

text.content:
Daniel got some chickens. 
Help him build a chicken coop where they’ll be safe and comfortable.

What might chickens need in their coop? 
How will this keep them safe? Comfortable?
Pick 10 materials from the box.

Describe them. Are they soft or hard? Strong? 
Use words or pictures. 
Then sort them.

Choose some for a chicken coop. 
Use them with LEGO® pieces to build a coop.

code_stack.title: SPIKE Essential Classify and Choose Materials
code_stack.xml: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" blockversion="12" ishorizontal="true" displaymonitorincludedimages="11"><variables></variables><block type="horizontalevents_whenColor" id="Sug*1%9wC[Bx8^h!,avr" x="87" y="81"><value name="COLOR"><shadow type="horizontalevents_horizontal-color-sensor" id="(E.Sb-}snF1j}4R6mL_J"><field name="field_horizontalevents_horizontal-color-sensor">3</field></shadow></value><next><block type="horizontalmotor_motorTurnCounterClockwiseRotations" id="G8{HBWX`kQoTXYL=$1~H"><value name="ROTATIONS"><shadow type="horizontalmotor_rotation-counter-clockwise" id="|R38)AcC%L$gW2unss;l"><field name="field_horizontalmotor_rotation-counter-clockwise">1.25</field></shadow></value><next><block type="horizontalsound_playAnimalSoundUntilDone" id="Z#v7;ZhlNmz([(5ahRsw"><value name="SOUND"><shadow type="horizontalsound_horizontal-animal-sound" id="e1eQAD[nY;+_c1L)*Jk:"><field name="field_horizontalsound_horizontal-animal-sound">3</field></shadow></value></block></next></block></next></block></xml>

text.content:
Program your model.
Make the door open and close. 
Keep the chickens safe in the coop.

Use your model to describe the materials you chose.
What are they like?
Why did you choose them.
Use your model to explain how you tested them.

Choose another animal. 
What does it need for a shelter?

Choose materials. 
Build the shelter.

Program it. 
Keep the animal safe and comfortable.
Great job!

teacher_support.things_you_will_need:
(one for every two students)
 - LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Essential Set
 - Device with the LEGO Education SPIKE App installed
 - See Prepare - Materials.

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Classify and Choose Materials

lessons.lesson_description: Daniel, Sofie, Leo, and Maria felt a strong wind at the park. It blew a lot of the soil away. What could happen to the animals in the park? Can you help the team protect the soil?
lessons.student_worksheet_description: Daniel, Sofie, Leo, and Maria felt a strong wind at the park. It blew a lot of the soil away. What could happen to the animals at the park? Can you help the team protect the soil?

text.content:
Daniel, Sofie, Leo, and Maria felt a strong wind at the park. 
It blew a lot of the soil away.

What could happen to the animals at the park? 
Can you help the team protect the soil?
What could happen to the soil at the park if the wind blows a lot over time?
How could this change the shape of the land?

What is weathering and erosion? 
What causes them?

Design a solution to prevent wind from taking the soil at the park.
Sketch your ideas.

Share ideas in the class to explain your design ideas.
Listen and think about which idea seems best.
Begin to build and program a model to protect the soil at the park from the wind.

Use your model to explain;
how does your design protect the park from the wind?
Continue to build and program your model.
Use your model to explain ways to protect the soil at the park from the wind.
Great job!

teacher_support.things_you_will_need:
(one for every two students)
 - LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Essential Set
 - Device with the LEGO Education SPIKE App installed
 - See Prepare - Materials.

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Protection from Wind

en-us.title: SPIKE Essential Science in Nature and Our Daily Life
en-us.unit_plan_description: Maria, Sofie, Leo, and Daniel want to know more about our natural world and the different materials in it. Let’s join them and some animals they meet!
en-us.unit_plan_subtitle: Science in Nature and Our Daily Life
en-us.unit_plan_title: Science in Nature and Our Daily Life
